To answer my own question:

Yes, JUnit does seem to cause threads to termiate after a period of time.  When
I ran the
same  test directly from the main() method, the loop did not terminate.  When I
ran the test
earlier from within a subclass of TestCase it did terminate.

Of course I am sure that this is probably spelt out clearly somewhere in the
documents,
but I wasn't abl to spot it.

Thanks again, for a very useful package. I am sure that I would be lost without
JUnit.

regards,

James


James Sinnamon wrote:

> My apologies if the question seems naive but I have been testing a program
> where
> the loop inside the run() method of a class which implements Runnable should
>
> NOT terminate, and yet it does seem to terminate.
>
> I see the message similar to the following:
>
>    Time: 0.566
>
> .. near the point of termination.
>
> Is it possible that the Junit TestCase class imposes a time limit, or is
> there something  about the Runnable interface that I need to
> underatand better, or do I need  to look even more closely
> at my own code?
>
> TIA
>
> James
